The innate immune system recognizes pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPS) mainly through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs). As one of the best characterized PRRs, Toll-like receptors (TLRs), which are widely distributed in antigen presenting cells and play an important role in triggering innate immunity and priming the adaptive immune response
107 . Therefore, several TLR agonists have been investigating as virus-specific vaccine adjuvants to induce strong and sustained immune responses
